Comment: I think that differs by state. In California, you generally do not need to go to the DMV to get a renewal (and most people do it by mail now), but for the REAL ID you do, so they can take your fingerprints and check some additional documents. When I did this, it took about 5 hours, plus the cost and time of being there on a weekday.

Comment: I had a real id (Colorado drivers license) but when I went to the dmv to get an Illinois drivers license they wouldn’t accept a copy of my birth certificate. So I didn’t have enough forms of ID to get a real ID, (I had my Colorado real ID, SSN card, mail, copy of my birth certificate etc.)   So it’s actually not that easy to get one. And I went from having one to not having one.
